thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: RBA leaves rates unchanged

title: RBA leaves rates unchanged
text:
View Photo 

The Reserve Bank has left the cash rate at a record low of two per cent for a fourth straight month. 
In a statement accompanying the decision, RBA governor Glenn Stevens noted recent volatility in global financial markets, sparked by worries about slowing Chinese economic growth, but also said the US economy is strengthening. 
Low interest rates continue to help the local economy and the current cash rate of two per cent "remains appropriate", he said. 
"Further information on economic and financial conditions to be received over the period ahead will inform the board's ongoing assessment of the outlook and hence whether the current stance of policy will most effectively foster sustainable growth," he said. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook RBA leaves rates unchanged AAP
